subject: Re: Pluggable Selector considered harmful? (Re: [junit] Re: Observations from a production use of JUnit4)
msgSnippet: ... Unit Tests are real safety.  Static typing is the illusion of safety,  I choose the former. Once, purely when reading the API javadoc, I saw a class,
messageBody:
On Feb 2, 2006, at 11:47 PM, Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> On 2/2/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>>
>>
>>> - Can break when refactoring
>>
>> That's why we have tests.
>
>
> No, that's why we have static typing.
>
> Besides, *you* have tests. Not everybody does.
>
> If I have to choose between "tests" and "tests and static typing",
> I will
> pick the latter any day.


Unit Tests are real safety. Static typing is the illusion of
safety, I choose the former.

Once, purely when reading the API javadoc, I saw a class,
java.lang.ClassCastException. There was this other one,
java.lang.RuntimeException. What are those, I wondered.

>
> --
> Cédric

--
Daryl
self email: ( daryl at: eddl dot: us )
